congVote.result: So the amendment was agreed to.
So the motion to recommit was rejected.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1004, to amend chapter 3 of title 5, United States Code, to require the publication of information relating to pending agency regulatory actions, by a recorded vote of 246 ayes to 176 noes, Roll No. 126.

congVote.result: Mr. McCONNELL. Mr. President, I move to reconsider the vote on the nomination, and I move to table the motion to reconsider.

extension.searchTitle: CLOTURE MOTION; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 37

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate confirmed the following nominations:<P/>By 58 yeas to 41 nays (Vote No. EX. 77), Benjamin S. Carson, Sr., of Florida, to be Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.<P/>By 62 yeas to 37 nays (Vote No. EX. 79), James Richard Perry, of Texas, to be Secretary of Energy.<P/>During consideration of this nomination today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 62 yeas to 37 nays (Vote No. 78), Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the nomination.

titleInfo.title: DISAPPROVING A RULE SUBMITTED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE, THE GENERAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION, AND THE NATIONAL AERONAUTICS AND SPACE ADMINISTRATION--MOTION TO PROCEED

extension.searchTitle: DISAPPROVING A RULE SUBMITTED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE, THE GENERAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION, AND THE NATIONAL AERONAUTICS AND SPACE ADMINISTRATION--MOTION TO PROCEED; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 37

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of H.J. Res. 37, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Defense, the General Services Administration, and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration relating to the Federal Acquisition Regulation.<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 51 yeas to 46 nays (Vote No. 80), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to consideration of the joint resolution.
